name: Hilton Garden Inn Nashville/Vanderbilt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the closest hotel, but still walkable especially to the Peabody side of Vanderbilt. Typical Garden Inn although the room felt somewhat small with two beds. Large TV. Nice indoor pool. Staff friendly. Rate was good for special event weekend. Charge for parking.
reviews.title: Close to Vanderbilt/Peabody

reviews.text: Nice rooms, but you pay for it. Its great for meetings and conferences. Probably wouldnt pick it if i was coming with my kids. The front clerks were helpful, and I had a good night sleep in the quiet rooms and comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Pricy but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Room was brand new and spacious. Close to all the attractions in Nashville.
reviews.title: Great brand new HGI near Vandy and downtown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only draw back was that the parking costs $18. Seemed a bit high for the area, but otherwise safe and secure parking.
reviews.title: The Extra Mile!

reviews.text: My wife and I, along with several other friends/family, stayed here to attend our son's wedding. Not only is the hotel beautiful and convenient to downtown activities, but the service was terrific! The front desk even allowed the wedding party to drop off our tuxedos after the wedding to be picked up the next day...a life saver! Great stay!
reviews.title: We were made to feel less important than other guests.

reviews.text: I stayed here for just one night but was impressed with the good customer service provided by the valet and check-in staff. They recommended a great place for lunch, Lime, which is just down the street. My room was clean and spacious. I had a lovely view of downtown Nashville. I stay at HGIs often and the newer ones always provide exactly what I need for my business trip. The workout room was a good size too.
reviews.title: Great Location, Wonderful Service

reviews.text: Recently my father was rushed to the hospital with a collapsed lung. I live about three hours from Nashville in a small community just northeast of Louisville, Kentucky. My 23 year old son and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn just blocks from Vanderbilt Hospital. From the first moment I walked into the lobby until we checked out, the entire experience was perfect. The staff was amazing, the rooms were immaculate, the chefs were so very talented and friendly - interacting with us before and after our meals. I promise you...if you have an emergency, this is the place to be. My father is home and recovering; but, I will certainly visit this hotel again ANYTIME I need or want to stay in Nashville.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect

reviews.text: I travelled alone to Nashville, wanted to stay a nice place!
reviews.title: A okay hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is okay.
reviews.title: Customer Service is NOT their forte.

reviews.text: The staff is not very helpful and are all a little bit strange.
reviews.title: Awful Experience AVOID!

reviews.text: I have been staying at this hotel on at least 4 or 5 occasions since January. They greet me at the front desk on a first name basis and always ask how I am doing. I have shown up last minute and never with a reservation from day one - and I always manage to get a room and extensions all of the time - since my trips are of a medical situation with a family member, my staying times vary.
reviews.title: Outstanding Quality and Very Friendly staff!

reviews.text: My rooms are always clean and fresh smelling and the bed I wish I had here at home!!!
reviews.title: Would never go back!

reviews.text: If ever I had any problems or something was not to my satisfaction I was able to talk
reviews.title: Get an EVEN Numbered Room!!! Otherwise, Nice HGI

reviews.text: to someone and have the problem fixed immediately. Now this may because I am always sure to treat the hotel staff as HUMAN BEINGS and say please and THANK-YOU
reviews.title: HGI-soundproof the rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: all the time!
reviews.title: Good for the most part

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing really sets this hotel apart as it is a standard Hilton Garden Inn property. This can be viewed as both positive and negative.
reviews.title: Typical Hilton Garden Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one downside is the noise for the rooms with the last digit being an odd number. They have a nice view however they also have street noise as a major issue as there is a lot of traffic on Broadway. A couple of times a night I would be woken up by ambulances heading to the Vanderbilt hospitals or by other traffic going by. And that's saying a lot as I live in an urban area and typically sleep like a rock. The even number rooms might have a boring view of the parking garage but almost certainly should be quieter.
reviews.title: Great Rate, comfortable bed, clean, spacious room and bath, what else is there?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $18 is a bit steep for parking considering other Hilton family hotels within a short distance don't charge. Plus there's no covered walkway/access from the garage to the hotel so you’ll get wet if it’s raining.
reviews.title: Loved the whirlpool king room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 37" LG HDTVs are very nice but they only have standard definition showing on them. In addition a couple of channels (including the local CBS affiliate) were so snowy they were unwatchable. It would be nice if they would at least get the basic channels in HD.
reviews.title: Noisy...

reviews.text: The location is very good with many restaurants within a walking distance along with short drives downtown and to the Vanderbilt campus.
reviews.title: Beware Of Hidden Fees

description: Located in mid-town Nashville conveniently located off I-65/I-40 on Broadway Avenue. Within a short distance of our newly built hotel is Nashville's bustling downtown area, the famous Music Row, and both Belmont and Vanderbilt Universities.
